title: Reference Cycles and Memory Leaks Without Garbage Collection

"""Universal class"""
class Node:
    def __init__(self):
        self.ref = None


"""Snippet A"""
import gc

gc.disable()
while True:
    x = Node()
    y = Node()
    x.ref = y
    y.ref = x
    # x and y out of scope here


"""Snippet B"""
import gc

gc.disable()
while True:
    x = Node()
    y = Node()
    x.ref = y
    # x and y out of scope here
options: A will run indefinitely; B will crash

from concurrent.futures import ThreadPoolExecutor, as_completed
import time

def task(n):
    time.sleep(n)
    return n

with ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=3) as executor:
    futures = [executor.submit(task, i) for i in [1, 4, 9]]

for f in as_completed(futures):
    print(f"{f.result()} finished at {round(time.time() - start, 1)}s")

title: Pattern Matching Dictionary Order

from collections import OrderedDict

dic1 = {'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': 3}
dic2 = {'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': 3, 'd': 4}
dic3 = OrderedDict(reversed(dic1.items()))

for d in (dic1, dic2, dic3):
    match d:
        
        case {'c': 3, 'a': 1}:
            print("1", end = "")

        case {'a': 1, 'c': 3}:
            print("2", end = "")

        case {'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': 3}:
            print("3", end = "")

        case {'c': 3, 'b': '2', 'a': 1}:
            print("4", end = "")

        case _:
            print("5", end = "")
